intro: Coccoloba nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in Nicaragua, Costa Rica, and Panama. This plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The fruit is a small, dark purple berry that matures in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
